author: gcolvin
content: I just counted 52 Ethereum channels.  I don't know what most any of them are for.  Discord beeps constantly - I generally have no idea which conversation it is beeping about.  So I mostly ignore them.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: <@!683653554631868440> you can mute channels your not interested in by right-clicking on them (or even on categories to mute a whole category)

author: 0xraino
content: <@683653554631868440> In a similar vein to <@360491619402776577> 's suggestion, you can set the channel default to notify only if mentioned so it applies to new channels. Then you can turn new channels up to full notifications at your discretion.

author: Deleted User
content: I have most channels muted as soon as they appear

author: Deleted User
content: there are just too many of them

author: gcolvin
content: Right.  But then I find out I've missed two months of important discussions on 7 channels.  Oh well,

author: sky.cactus
content: I recommend muting whole categories.  Like Bots for example.

author: gcolvin
content: This place is a low-rent Slack.

author: gcolvin
content: Maybe...  Is there a place where the beeps form a chronological queue?  The worst thing is the constant polling of channels to see what is happening.  Or hearing a bunch of beeps and having no idea where they came from.

author: _shemnon
content: EIP-2929 clarification:  The changes to the non storage operators is a surcharge on top of the existing costs or does it replace the entire cost?  (EXTCODESIZE, EXTCODECOPY, EXTCODEHASH, BALANCE (0x31), CALL, CALLCODE, DELEGATECALL , STATICCALL) . EXTCODECOPY is a variable formula so a straight replacement seems unlikely.

author: _shemnon
content: Also, how does the WARM_STOAGE_READ_COST interact with the STATICCALL cost reductions for precompiles?  Not in YOLOv2 but this seems to undo that change pre-emptively.
